description: Part single part two storey rear extension; alterations of roof from pitch to mansard profile and increase in height to rear outrigger; conversion of first floor and roof space to create one 1x bedroom and one 2x bedroom self-contained flats.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers B3271-21 rev. A and B3271 - 22 rev A received 12th February 2012, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority. REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	In the interest of securing a high quality development and to ensure that the resulting appearance and construction of the development preserves the character of the building and  the visual amenity of the area as a whole in accordance with section 7 the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 2.10  of the Ealing's Development Strategy and policy 7B of the Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document with Minor Changes (Consolidated Incorporating Further Alterations) Submission Document EDM3 (February 2013) | Details of cycle parking shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing before the first occupation of the development hereby approved and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details. 	 REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for cycle parking within the site, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2011. | Details of insulation shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority for the floor/ceiling separating the commercial part of the premises from the residential accommodation hereby approved, before the development is commenced, to demonstrate that they are resistant to the passage of smoke, fumes and odours and that the insulation is sufficient to prevent noise disturbance.  Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any of the units and shall thereafter be permanently retained.  REASON: To prevent noise disturbance in the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of the residential element of the proposed development in accordance with section  4 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies  4.1 and 4.11of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment', policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing's Development Strategy 2026  and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration' and policy 7A of the Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document with Minor Changes (Consolidated Incorporating Further Alterations) Submission Document EDM3 (February 2013) | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, a noise survey and details for mitigation works, inclluding the insulation of the building envelope with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided to protect habitable rooms fronting The Broadway  from traffic/ aircraft noise shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The mitigation shall take into account the ventilation strategy for the building approved in accordance with Condition 7 of this permission.  The approved details shall be fully implemented prior to the first occupation of the building and retained thereafter.  REASON:  To protect occupiers of the building from noise as the development will be affected by high levels of traffic noise, in accordance with section 4 of  the National Plannign Policy Framework, policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing's Development Strategy 2026  and Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG 10: 'Noise and Vibration' and and policy 7A of the Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document with Minor Changes (Consolidated Incorporating Further Alterations) Submission Document EDM3 (February 2013) | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, details of a ventilation strategy setting out measures to provide fresh air ventilation from the rear of the building  at high level to the habitable rooms of the residential units facing The Broadway shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The approved measures shall be fully installed prior to first occupation of the development and shall be retained thereafter.  REASON: To ensure suitable measures are installed to protect residents from air pollution, in accordance with section 4 of  the National Plannign Policy Framework, policy 2.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing's Development Strategy 2026  and Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG 3: 'Air Quality' and policy 7A of the Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document with Minor Changes (Consolidated Incorporating Further Alterations) Submission Document EDM3 (February 2013) | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, all the 1st floor windows in the flank elevation of the extensions hereby approved shall contain obscured glazing up to a height of 1.70m, measured from the floor level of the room they serve and this shall be retained thereafter.  REASON: To prevent loss of privacy in the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of the residential element of the proposed development and neighbouring properties in accordance with section  7 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 3.5 of the London Plan 2011policies  4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment', policies Ealing Local Variation to London Plan policy 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document with Minor Changes (Consolidated Incorporating Further Alterations) Submission Document EDM3 (February 2013).
